cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwave in progress.  So far, 6 heatwaves have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The storm today is ranked 8th for the amount of rainfall recorded during one storm.  13.04mm fell at a maximum rate of 8.6mm per hour over 7.9 hours.  On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 27.64mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 15.9 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A rapid deluge happened today when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour (ranked highest in our records).  The storm lasted 2.0 hours and 7.99mm of precipitation fell during that time.

storm.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 23 November 2024, the storm lasted 23.2 hours with a total precipitation of 24.56mm reaching 6.4mm per hour at times.
We are currently experiencing a storm.  This is the first such event since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: Currently experiencing a significant rainy period, ranked 5th longest since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 9 consecutive days beginning 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (202°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 75.46 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.0 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1548 m) and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 43.7m higher than yesterday, 444.3m lower than the past week, 1548.0m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 713m to 1594m and averaged 1110.7m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, the air will be thick and uncomfortable and little or no wind. Periods of rain anticipated, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and a mix of sun and clouds. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
